newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico CCP rate falls to 7.08 pct for September.
newsitem.headline: Mexico CCP rate falls to 7.08 pct for September.

text.p: Banco de Mexico announced on Monday that the Cost of Contracting Debt (CCP) in dollars for Mexican banks in September was 7.08 percent, compared with 7.12 percent in August.
The central bank in April began calculating the CCP, which may be used as a benchmark rate to determine interest rates for credits denominated in dollars.
The CCP is the average bank term desposit cost measured in pesos in Mexican banks.
The monthly calculation of the CCP-dollar rate includes loans extended by foreign banks and financing from Export-Import banks, the Commodity Credit Corporation and other similar organizations.
The CCP-dollar rate is published between the 8th and 12th of the month following the basis month in the Mexican Government's Official Gazette.
